definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
to avoid external disturbance in order to idle

sentences.english: You don't want to have to think too much. Your job is just to relax and vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 你不想喝太多酒，你只想去放松下，清闲下。

sentences.english: " Such as access Xian Xiang, who "to Pepsi's listen, " he will be a leisure.
sentences.chinese: 如得到贤相，由他“要百事之听”，自己便清闲了。

sentences.english: Use this time to reflect, review, and meditate.
sentences.chinese: 利用这段清闲时光去思考，回顾和计划。

sentences.english: I am also happy to leisure, to the downstairs room to find a landlord asked for a menu.
sentences.chinese: 我也乐得清闲，到楼下去找房东要了一张送餐的菜单。

sentences.english: Danielle: Well, most of the time it’s pretty 2)cruisy.
sentences.chinese: 丹妮尔:大多数时候相当清闲。

sentences.english: Let the evening forgive the mistakes of the day and thus win peace for herself.
sentences.chinese: 让黄昏海涵白昼的过失吧，并是以为她自己赢得清闲。

definition: to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work/also written 偷閒|偷闲[tou1 xian2]
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
to have nothing to do/to have time on one's hands
free and at leisure (idiom); unfettered/outside the reach of the law (of criminal)/at large
variant of 閒人|闲人[xian2 ren2]/idle person/idler/unconcerned person
see 悠哉悠哉[you1 zai1 you1 zai1]
